title: Firefox 40.0a2 Aurora

notes.note:
Added [protection against unwanted software][1] downloads


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/security/2015/08/11/expanded-malware-protection-in-firefox/
New style for add-on manager based on the in-content preferences style
Improved scrolling, graphics, and video playback performance with off main thread compositing (GNU/Linux only)

[Process separation][1] enabled for opt-in testing

  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/Firefox/Multiprocess_Firefox
Graphic blocklist mechanism improved: Firefox version ranges can be specified, limiting the number of devices blocked

NPAPI Plug-in performance improved via [asynchronous initialization][1]

  [1]: http://dblohm7.ca/blog/2014/06/17/asynchronous-plugin-initialization-an-introduction/

Smoother animation and scrolling with [hardware vsync][1] (Windows only)

  [1]: https://hacks.mozilla.org/2015/01/project-silk/
JPEG images use less memory when scaled and can be painted faster

Support for running [animations][1] of 'transform' and 'opacity' on the compositor thread


  [1]: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Platform/GFX/OffMainThreadCompositing#CSS_Animations

Sub-resources [can no longer request HTTP authentication][1], thus protecting users from inadvertently disclosing login data


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox/Releases/40/Site_Compatibility#Security

[IndexedDB transactions][1] are now non-durable by default

[1]:https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/IndexedDB_API/Basic_Concepts_Behind_IndexedDB#durable

Implemented [AudioBufferSourceNode.detune][1] to modulate playback rate in cents, a logarithmic unit of measure used for
musical intervals

  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/AudioBufferSourceNode/detune

Improved [Performance tools][1] in the developer tools: [Waterfall][2] view, [Call Tree][3] view and a [Flame Chart][4] view


  [1]: https://hacks.mozilla.org/?p=28808
  [2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Performance/Waterfall
  [3]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Performance/Call_Tree
  [4]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Performance/Flame_Chart

New [rules view tooltip][1] in the Inspector to tweak CSS Filter values


  [1]: http://youtu.be/t3NKmmWfklU

New page ruler highlighting tool that displays [lightweight horizontal and vertical rules][1] on a page 


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Rulers
Console API messages from SharedWorker and ServiceWorker are now displayed in web console
Inspector now searches across all content frames in a page
Removed support for binary XPCOM components in extensions, use addon SDK "system/child_process" pipe mechanism for native binaries instead
Kannada text does not display properly in built-in pdf viewer

If Firefox is restarted from an add-on install notification, on-going private browsing downloads might be canceled without warning  ([1185294][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1185294

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems
 - Windows XP SP2
 - Windows Server 2003 SP1
 - Windows Vista
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10

*Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Firefox, only 32-bit builds of Firefox are supported at this time.*

### Recommended Hardware
-  Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
-  512MB of RAM
-  200MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- Mac OS X 10.6
- Mac OS X 10.7
- Mac OS X 10.8
- Mac OS X 10.9
- Mac OS X 10.10

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 2.18 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher
